definitions.definition: to lean, or make something lean, in a particular direction

examples.text: He bent and kissed her.
The doctor told me to avoid bending and stretching.
fields of poppies bending in the wind
She suddenly bent over, clutching her stomach.
She bent over him to reach her book.
He bent forward to pick up the package.
Slowly bend from the waist and bring your head down to your knees.
Keep your feet apart, and bend at the waist
He bent his head and kissed her.
She bent her head towards him.
She was bent over her desk writing a letter.
He came closer and bent towards her.
I bent down and tied my shoelace.
I had to bend double to get under the table.
Sarah bent close to him.

definitions.definition: if you bend your arm, leg, etc. or if it bends, you move it so that it is no longer straight

examples.text: **Bend your knees**, keeping your back straight.
Lie flat and let your knees bend.

definitions.definition: to force something that was straight into an angle or a curve

examples.text: Mark the pipe where you want to bend it.
The knives were bent out of shape.
He bent the wire into the shape of a square.

definitions.definition: to change direction to form a curve or an angle; to make something change direction in this way

examples.text: The road bent sharply to the right.
Glass and water both bend light.

definitions.definition: to talk to somebody a lot about something, especially about a problem that you have
to think very hard about or put a lot of effort into one particular thing

examples.text: She bent her mind to the problem of escape.

definitions.definition: to make a great effort, especially in order to be helpful or fair

examples.text: I've bent over backwards to help him.

definitions.definition: to change the rules to suit a particular person or situation

examples.text: Couldn't they just bend the rules and let us in without a ticket?

definitions.definition: to say something that is not completely true

examples.text: I wasn’t exactly lying when I said I hadn’t seen her—I was just bending the truth a little.

definitions.definition: if you ask for something on bended knee(s), you ask for it in a very anxious and/or humble way (= showing you think you are less important than the person you are asking)

examples.text: I’d go down on bended knee if I thought she’d change her mind.

wordOrigin: Old English bendan ‘put in bonds, tension a bow by means of a string’, of Germanic origin; related to band ‘strip of material’.
